title: Create bashx RPC binding for pyx.do
description:
Add pyx.do as a Tier 2 RPC service in bashx's TieredExecutor.

Commands to route:
- python, python3
- pip, pipx, uvx, pyx
- pypi (for registry operations)

Integration in tiered-executor.ts:
```typescript
python: {
  commands: ['python', 'python3', 'pip', 'pipx', 'uvx', 'pyx'],
  endpoint: 'https://pyx.do',
}
```

Usage examples:
- bash`python -c "print('hello')"`
- bash`pipx run black --check .`
- bash`uvx ruff check .`

title: Design package routing architecture
description:
Design the routing layer that maps package requests to appropriate Workers.

Tiered approach:
- Tier 1 (Hot): Pre-deployed Workers with memory snapshots (<100ms)
- Tier 2 (Warm): Pyodide-native packages via micropip (~1s)
- Tier 3 (Cold): Pure Python packages via micropip (~5s)
- Tier 4 (Sandbox): Full Linux for C-extensions (~10-30s)

Router responsibilities:
- Parse package specification (name@version)
- Check if pre-deployed Worker exists
- Check Pyodide compatibility
- Route to appropriate tier
- Handle fallback cascade

title: Build PyPI registry client
description:
Create a PyPI registry client similar to bashx's npmx module for interacting with pypi.org.

Features needed:
- Package metadata retrieval (JSON API)
- Version resolution (PEP 440 semver)
- Wheel/tarball downloading
- Integrity verification (SHA256, BLAKE2b)
- Search functionality

Reference: bashx's src/npmx/registry-client.ts for patterns

title: Implement generic Pyodide Worker with micropip
description:
Create a fallback Worker that can load any pure Python package via micropip at runtime.

Features:
- Dynamic package installation via micropip
- Support for Pyodide-native packages (numpy, pandas)
- Version specification support (@version syntax)
- Caching of installed packages in R2

Limitations to document:
- 5-10 second cold starts
- Only pure Python and Pyodide packages supported
- No arbitrary C extensions

This is Tier 2/3 for packages not in the pre-deployed fleet.

title: Create pre-deployed Pyodide Workers for popular packages
description:
Deploy a fleet of Workers with pre-built memory snapshots for popular Python CLI tools.

Initial packages (Tier 1 hot):
- black (formatter)
- ruff (linter)
- pytest (testing)
- mypy (type checker)
- isort (import sorter)
- flake8 (linting)
- pylint (linting)
- bandit (security)

Each Worker needs:
- pyproject.toml with package declared
- Memory snapshot for fast cold starts
- HTTP endpoint for execution

Target latency: <100ms
